description: Manages dds instance resource within FlexibleEngine

StorageEngine.description: Specifies the storage engine of the DB instance. Only wiredTiger is supported now.

Type.description: Specifies the DB engine. Only DDS-Community is supported now.

Version.description: Specifies the DB instance version. Only 3.4 is supported now.

Num.description:
Specifies the node quantity. Valid value:
* the number of mongos ranges from 2 to 12.
* the number of shard ranges from 2 to 12.
* config: the value is 1.
* replica: the value is 1.

Size.description:
Specifies the disk size. The value must be a multiple of 10. The unit is GB. This parameter
is mandatory for nodes except mongos and invalid for mongos.

SpecCode.description: Specifies the resource specification code. Valid values:.

Storage.description: Specifies the disk type. Valid value: ULTRAHIGH which indicates the type SSD.

Type.description: Specifies the node type. Valid value: mongos, shard, config, replica.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AvailabilityZone.description:
Specifies the ID of the availability zone. Changing
this creates a new instance.

DiskEncryptionId.description:
Specifies the disk encryption ID of the instance.
Changing this creates a new instance.

Mode.description:
Specifies the mode of the database instance. Changing this creates
a new instance.

Name.description:
Specifies the DB instance name. The DB instance name of the same
type is unique in the same tenant. Changing this creates a new instance.

Password.description:
Specifies the Administrator password of the database instance.
Changing this creates a new instance.

Region.description:
Specifies the region of the DDS instance. Changing this creates
a new instance.

SecurityGroupId.description:
Specifies the security group ID of the DDS instance.
Changing this creates a new instance.

SubnetId.description: Specifies the subnet Network ID. Changing this creates a new instance.

VpcId.description:
Specifies the VPC ID. For details about how to obtain this
parameter value, see section "Virtual Private Cloud" in the Virtual Private
Cloud API Reference. Changing this creates a new instance.
